meanings.definition: The quality or state of being mutinous.
meanings.sent1: The mutinousnesses of the crew led to a shipboard revolt.
meanings.sent2: Her mutinousnesses were evident in her refusal to follow orders.
meanings.sent3: The mutinousnesses of the toddlers at the daycare made the teachers laugh.
meanings.sent4: The mutinousnesses in the air were palpable as the students planned a protest.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds overhead seemed to mirror the mutinousnesses of the crowd below.

meanings.definition: The behavior or attitude of being rebellious or disobedient.
meanings.sent1: The mutinousnesses of the students disrupted the class.
meanings.sent2: His mutinousnesses often got him in trouble with the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The cat showed mutinousnesses by knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The mutinousnesses of the waves crashing against the shore were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The mutinousnesses of the protesters could be heard from blocks away.
